description.narrative: The project involves an IFC investment in two subsidiaries of OAO Energomera Concern (Energomera Group): namely OAO Monocrystal (Monocrystal), and ZAO Energomera (Energomera). Energomera develops and produces a wide range of electronic metering technologies and equipment. Monocrystal produces (i) synthetic sapphires - the key material for substrate used in the production of light-emitting diodes (LEDs), and (ii) special materials (namely aluminum photovoltaic paste) used in the production of solar cells.

i.The project is expected to contribute to the energy savings in Russia through wider use of metering, especially new generation meters, and lead to reduced GHG emissions in the longer term. Monocrystal's increased production will support further reduction in GHG emissions through the use of LED lighting and employment of solar cells in electricity generation. ii.Employment preservation: IFC's investment will support one of the largest employers in Stavropol. Moreover, Energomera is a high-technology employer in a region where employment opportunities are generally limited to agriculture jobs. Currently the Company employs approximately 4 500 people of which 2 300 are female. iii. Monocrystal is an export oriented company which brings foreign currency denominated revenues to Russia.
